waste_details.reason_for_no_provision: General Bin Area with recyled and bio waste facilities

description: Single storey rear extensions and part rear first floor extensions to 170-172 Carr Road (Joint application)(following demolition of existing outbuildings and single storey rear extension to no.170 Carr Road)
subdivision_of_building: Rear Ground Floor and part rear first floor
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):  2368-PROP_01 Ground Floor Site Plan, 2368-PROP_02 Proposed First Floor Plan, 2368-PROP_03 Proposed Front Elevation, 2368-PROP_04 Proposed Rear Elevation and 2368-PROP_05 Proposed Side Elevation
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be consistent with those listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Development Management DPD (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), policies 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and policies 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2024 (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the house.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.19), policy D3 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023)(Updated).
